title: Drawing, "George C. and Eleanor Hutton Rand Apartment: Bedroom/Dressing Room", May 20, 1934
medium: Graphite on tracing paper, double ruled border in graphite
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: DONALD DESKEY/145 WEST 57TH STREET/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, upper center: BEDROOM [bed circled]/STUDIO 46 WASHINGTON MEWS; inscribed in office stamp, lower right: 520-6/ 1/2"=1'0"/ RAND, E.D.S./ 5/20/34, 5/21/34, 3/ 8/14/34 / 8/30/34, 8/14/34, 4/ 8/30, 4; inscribed schedule at center right: SCHEDULE/ WOOD SHELVING & TRAYS HARDWOOD FOR PAINTING/SHEET ROCK FURRING WHERE INDICATED/2 FLUSH PANELS DOORS. BUCKS & TRIM/WOOD POLES IN CLOSETS/NEW LAVATORY INSTALLED/NEW MEDICINE CABINET & GLASS SHELVING/MIRROR, RADIATOR ENCLOSURE/WIRING FOR OUTLETS AT MIRROR & MED. CABINET/WIRING FOR BASE OUTLETS & CLOSET OUTLETS/STOCK HARDWARE (RUSSELL & IRWIN)/SLIDING WOOD DOORS/WALL SAFE (YORK SAFE& LOCK CO. # 531)/GLASS PARTITION/REMOVE PRESENT RADIATOR AND RELOCATE NEW RAD.
description: Plan and elevations for bedroom/dressing room. Small bed, or chaise lounge in middle of room towards left. North wall has door near right and built-in shelving on the left; sliding shoe trays on lower half of wall, with wooden pole at middle and near ceiling for hanging items. Shelving able to be concealed by curtain on a track. Vertical wood shelves and more sliding trays on west wall; wood poles at top and middle. East wall has wood pole at top, middle, and pole near floor for shoes on left side of wall, vanity mirror and sink at center of wall, and door to right. Two large windows on south wall; ottoman placed between windows. Curtains can wrap around entire room to conceal shelves and sink.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "George C. and Eleanor Hutton Rand Apartment: Bedroom/Dressing Room", May 20, 1934.
May 20, 1934. Graphite on tracing paper, double ruled border in graphite. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-537.
